scenes.location: UPPER MIDDLE CLASS RESIDENTIAL HOUSE, QUEENS NYC -
characters: INT. PARKING YARD OF STANDARD HEATING OIL- SAME TIME
EXT. STREET OUTSIDE THE FRONT GATE- SAME TIME
EXT. MORE INDUSTRIAL QUEENS NEIGHBORHOOD- SAME TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open on ABEL MORALES. It is early morning and still almos dark out. He has a rugged yet prosperously-handsome face is in his mid-thirties. He is struggling to get started w his morning jog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is early morning. A large bulk fuel oil transport truc sits idling next to a decrepit old dock. The dock sticks a backwater section of New York harbor that is filled wit the decaying remains of half-sunken abandoned barges and boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN, the young driver of the truck sits and nervously scans the horizon. Eventually a large fuel barge appears the distance being pushed by a tug boat. The barge is ste past the skeletons of the other sunken ships and makes it way to the dock in front of the tanker truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN gets out of his truck and readies a large connecti hose. He looks around nervously. JULIAN steps across the broken boards of the dock and struggles to get the hose t the barge. He hands it to the BARGE OPERATOR with a nod o the head and no words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They connect the hose and start a large generator as it begins to pump fuel into the truck. They both scan the horizon again as the sun begins to come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is still jogging as the light begins to increase. It freezing out. He is a very serious guy. He is not happy t he is out of shape. Finally he stops and bends over to ca his breath. We have run with him from the nicer part of t neighborhood to a rougher section. As he catches his brea he stands up and looks around. He is unsure of his feelin 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera slowly moves in as ANNA sits in a slip at her up table putting on her face for the day ahead. She looks into the mirror as if she is putting on a coat of armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANDARD HEATING OIL, "We set the Standard" is written in logo form on the side of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck idles in traffic waiting to pay the toll to cro the Verrazano bridge that spans the mouth of New York har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN, the young driver from the dock, cautiously looks around as the traffic inches along. He finally approaches toll booth and pays.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN speaks English with a well-sanded accent. Is it Central American or Mexican? The female collector gives h smile. He heads through the booth, but there is still traffic on other side as the lanes merge together. Just as the traff is about to pick up he looks in his rearview mirror and w see TWO GUYS come walking through the traffic and towards cab. Before we know it they are climbing up the cab steps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUY on the driver's side, LOUIS SERVIDIO, is small an very slight but he moves with great speed and strength. H shatters the glass side window with his elbow. Unlocks th door just as his partner, THUG #2, does the same thing on passenger side, but he is holding a gun. They are not wea masks. It's very brazen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before THUG #2 even asks JULIAN to get out of the cab LOU SERVIDIO crushes him in the jaw with three swift punches pulls him out of the cab and down onto the roadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUIS SERVIDIO pulls the door shut and they drive away wi the truck leaving JULIAN sitting in the middle of the roa staring, as blood starts to flow from his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two almost-matching late model Mercedes pull up to a chai link gate with a small sign that says "STANDARD HEATING O WE SET THE STANDARD". The DISPATCHER opens the gate. 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both pull into reserved parking spaces next to each other. ABEL is dressed in a very tasteful custom made sui ABEL's wife ANNA was driving the car behind him. She is a beautiful, tall, blonde woman dressed to the nines but wi streak in her eye that this is all business. You would no want to cross this woman.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look very nice.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks around and opens his trunk. He takes out two l empty briefcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carries the briefcases as they both walk over to a lar unmarked, armored van that is idling in the middle of the parking lot. Two ARMED GUARDS get out of the van. One is holding a clipboard. He walks up to ANNA and ABEL. He han them the clipboard. They look at each other one last time then both sign the document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other GUARD opens up the back of the truck. ABEL hand him the briefcases and the guard begins to fill them with cash. Lots of cash. ABEL and ANNA stand at the open back the van and just watch. Finally he finishes and hands the heavy cases to ABEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL picks up the two cases and walks a bit away from the truck. He turns to ANNA.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything stupid.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have any more money so what else could I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives a small smile. He looks at his watch. They kiss 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL turns and begins walking with the cases. He gives a to the DISPATCHER, who we now see, is in a small gatehous and he begins to open the front gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks out through the gate and down the abandoned industrial street about 25 yards, then looks to his right looks down at the cases in his hands, turns, and stands looking into the neighboring site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes walking across the parking lot and sees ANDREW WALSH standing in the middle of the dusty parking lot. AN is their longtime LAWYER/RIGHT-HAND MAN and is in his mid fifties. He is smart but tired. The oversized briefcase i his left hand seems to have permanently tilted his postur that direction. The large oil-holding tanks loom above th The place is rusting and could use some work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they wait, the setting has the look and choreography o illegal transaction about to go down. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how are we this morning?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives a smile and nod)  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I woke up feeling very good about this.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both take a look at their watches.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been telling me not to do this for a year.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we are going all in... so now I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives him another slight smile. They stand around in awkw silence. Finally a late-model Ford Ltd. station wagon pul into the lot. 6

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we go. And a group of FIVE HASIDIC JEWS gets out. There are two in their twenties, two in their fifties, and one in his m to-late seventies. They all shake each other's hands then stand around for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Should we head inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is now jammed around a folding table inside the trailer. ABEL and his lawyer sit at one end facing the re of them. Finally, the senior member of the group, JOSEPH MENDELSOHN, eyes up ABEL and leans forward. His accent is strong yet you can understand every word.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why is it you want this land?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry? JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been difficult for you to get me here, no? Over a year?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost two.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are many like it around? And thanks to all these tests you paid for, we now know it is as much of a mess below the ground as it is above. My people have looked at your books, I know this is a lot of money for you, so why have you kept on us so... just for this ugly and polluted little piece of the earth.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been looking over my fence at this property for a very long time.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it is just proximity? 7   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I imagine I want it for the same reason you did.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's that?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To grow. JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I am in the garment business so I appreciate that sentiment. But I inherited this land from my uncle. Sadly he had no children of his own. He was the one that let them build these tanks here. So this place can do little for me... in fact thanks to all those tests you've done it may be a liability. As you know I offered to lease the site to you at a fair price, but you were not interested?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to own the things I use.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. This contract here, your lawyers have fully reviewed it?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have brought the money? (ABEL nodes yes) So you realize you have only thirty days to close this transaction? (MORE) 8  JOSEPH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No extensions, no... contingencies whatsoever. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know this up front. I am a very fair man but I believe in honoring contracts. You will fulfill your end of this contract and the property is yours. If you can't we will keep your money and will sell it to your competitor who has been chasing us almost as badly as you have. I like you, but know that the only reason I am choosing you is because of the favorable terms of this contract. So this is business... and when you sign this....  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, let's see this money, and then I will sign these papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL turns to ANDREW and gives a slight nod. ANDREW pulls black briefcase onto the table and opens it. It has seven hundred thousand dollars in cash in it. He slides it over their side. The old man signs the contract and they shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL stands next to ANDREW's car.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not ours yet.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was a hell of a job just getting them to this point. It's a good day for us. Take a walk around. Enjoy it for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW gets in his car and drives away. ABEL looks around decides to go for a little walk. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads out towards the tanks and walks among them. They tower seven stories above him. As he walks, he is cut off like a maze from any other visual input. (Similar to bein inside a Richard Serra sculpture) Finally he emerges into some light and as ABEL looks up the camera reveals his vi It's midtown Manhattan in all its glory, just across the River from the site. He stares at the city and we see the true depths of his ambition lock on his face. He looks to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL drives away from New York City. We see it behind his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrain turns to upscale country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL's car drives into a long driveway through the woods. Then an architect-designed, 80's modern house, still unde construction, appears. He pulls up in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of the car and stands there looking at the la house. He walks into the house and we see more clearly th it is nearing completion. It is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks over to the massive floor-to-ceiling windows a stands looking over the large pond that sits down the hil from the house. As he stares out his CONTRACTOR comes qui walking in behind him.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up behind him and they both look out in silence a beat.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have done a beautiful job here.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. 10   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it. You and your men should be very proud.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people don't have anything beautiful like this to show for their day's work. You are a lucky man.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I thank you... my family will be very happy here.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I think I owe you some money. CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be true.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL reaches into his jacket pocket and takes out a thick envelope of cash. As he does we see a transformation of h personality from pleasant philosopher to a direct voice o unquestioned authority.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the seventeen outstanding. But we are arriving here in four days. It must be done.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says this as he leads him to the door.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the tile in the master bath... 11   CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's being replaced, as I mentioned to your wife, that was an error on our part. Congratulations on your home.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL stands, surrounded by massive trees in the thick for looking across the ridge back at his house. He is a littl out of breath after climbing the hill but he looks strang comfortable even though he is standing in the woods in a suit, tie, and dress shoes. He takes a nice cigar out of pocket, lights it and has a real moment of joy. He looks to the tops of the trees, then back at the new house. He exhales a long deep breath. Then we hear a large truck co rumbling in the driveway. He hears it. His face shows tha knows the sound immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes out of the woods and sees a smaller heating oi delivery truck (with the same Standard Heating Oil logo) parked in the driveway. His face shows it probably isn't great news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes down a hallway and then turns through a curtai into a treatment area. Sitting on the table is the young driver of the truck, JULIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a contraption on his head that is holding his jaw in place. His eye is black. ABEL goes over and gives him tight hug. But then he ever so slightly checks himself an places him back down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks up and sees ANNA, standing in the corner. She all business. They stare at each other.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They broke his jaw.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they found the truck? 12   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?  JULIAN (NODS YES)  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the police been here yet?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was left in the middle of the highway without a truck, they brought him in.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you speak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA'S temper is rising.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a couple days... Can I speak with you outside? ANNA heads out into the hallway. ABEL looks around a beat then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is waiting in the hallway.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they sign the contract?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And took the deposit?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's a go?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he gives a nice nod yes)  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. 13   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you as well. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have thirty days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods ever so slightly yes, and she gives him a knowing smile back of equal measure. We are beginning to see that they actually work quite well together. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These fucking guys. This poor kid has been working his ass off.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to speak to my Brother about this?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...don't talk to him or your father.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't continue.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will if we don't do something.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm meeting with the D.A. in the morning.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck the D.A. He's more interested in coming after us than helping us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks around in disapproval. She thinks this through then looks in at JULIAN.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not fair to them. You're at war here.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we are not.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really... because they are. 14   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm not. They look each other over. She then finally leans in and gives him a caring kiss, she walks off.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're going out to check on the new house? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her walk away then looks back into the hospita room. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks into the room and looks at JULIAN. He looks up ABEL has trouble putting it to words.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN gives a nod. ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get you anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nods no.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pick you up when they let you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men are cowards. Too weak to make a living... or even fight with their own hands, and too stupid to think up anything else to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL drives up to the drop off scene. There is the large transport truck and one lone police car just sitting in t middle of the parking lot. 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL gets out, walks up, and stops to stare at the truck. young beat cop is sitting on the hood of his car waiting. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I take it?  BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I take it now?  BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it yours?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry about that. Once the owner or an owner's representative files the claim form in Corona she's yours... again.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you guys have done what you needed to?  BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what was that?  BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said you've done what you needed to... so what was it that you've done?  BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks back dumbfounded)  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you fingerprint or anything?  BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need, these guys always wear gloves.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've done nothing. 16   BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not exactly sure, I just got here at four. My shift is actually up.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other, then the truck. ABEL then climb and we see he knows his way around the truck. He goes up and opens and looks into a valve, the tank is empty.  BEAT COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop gets in his car and prepares to drive away.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did they want it?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stole the $6,000 of fuel that was in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop leaves. ABEL is left standing on top of the truck the parking lot alone with his battered truck. He looks d at the open loading valve and begins to come up with an i The sun is setting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign on the inside of the gate reads. "It's not safety first... It's safety always". The motor on the gate start and it opens. In drives ABEL'S car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is working away on an adding machine in her office. is listening to the radio that sits behind her on the des We can see that she is in her comfort zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ASSISTANT D.A. is sitting behind his desk as DEPUTY L stands off to the side. He is only in his early thirties with confidence and ego to spare. They know each other.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Andrew. 17   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence. Thank you for seeing us on such short notice.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Of course. And Mr. Morales. Please sit. I didn't realize you were coming as well.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: So what can I do for you?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: In what way?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our trucks. They are being robbed.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (he looks over at DEPUTY LANGE)  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a serious security issue.  DEPUTY LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There have been a series of hijackings of bulk-fuel delivery vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Yes.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our drivers are being put in danger.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Mr. Walsh, as I know you know, this office has been investigating your entire industry.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward pause as LAWRENCE decides how he shou continue. 18

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: And as much as I'd like to be able to help you, you know this is a police issue. It's not what we do here.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. But this is turning into an urgent and pressing matter for us.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Urgent?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what you mean. There were more murders and rapes in this city last year then there ever have been, so if you have come to tell me that we have a urgent security issue here, trust me I'm aware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL cuts in. He can't help himself. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people are at risk just driving around in this city, just trying to do their jobs. And I... I have done everything you have asked of me. It's been two years since you first started investigating my company and I have spent thousands of dollars hiring lawyers for this and that to provide you with every piece of information your office has requested. And I expect that you have been asking the same from my competitors. So with all this information that you have gained... We are just asking if you have any idea who has been doing this to us?

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sits unanswered. 19

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I understand your frustration. And although everyone else seems to have given up and left this city for dead, I haven't. And as you know we have been investigating industry-wide corruption in your business that seems to have been going on for years. And the simple fact is that the only person who could do anything with 8000 gallons of heating oil in a matter of minutes after stealing a truck is someone from within that industry. And almost certainly someone with local storage capacity. So you're right. That means you all are stealing from each other. Which is, as far as I can tell, just a refreshing new take on what you've been doing to your customers and fellow taxpayers for the last fifteen years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sits in the room for a long beat. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, please know that we respect the work you are doing to try to help our business and the city. But also know I have never taken anything I haven't earned from anyone so when you say you've...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls himself back.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on the same side here.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Well yes and no. See, all that I can do is to try and put people away in the simplest and most economical way possible with the limited resources at my disposal. It doesn't really matter to us who it is or how we do it as long as it's progress.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it makes a difference to me. 20

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I know it does. This city is a very difficult place to do business right now.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This more conciliatory tone makes LAWRENCE think through next reply for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You know... Mr. Morales you seem like a decent man, and because of that I'm really not comfortable just sitting here with you pretending that the elephant perched on the corner of my desk isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAWRENCE looks over at DEPUTY LANGE whose body language s `don't go down this road'. But he does.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't go into specifics at this moment but we believe that you and your company have broken the law and that we have enough evidence to prove that. So next week, Monday actually, we will be bringing a case against you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This drops like a bomb. ABEL and LAWRENCE stare at each other. Then ABEL glances to the corner of the desk. We se that a large draft copy of the case is actually sitting there. ABEL looks back up.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to do this in person. It's awkward, obviously, but I didn't want to have this happen on Monday not having said something here in person today, out of respect.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL stands up to leave and ANDREW is still a little stun but stands. 21   ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your job to do. But know that you are wrong and that we will take advantage of every opportunity to prove that.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'm sure you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to leave. And LAWRENCE has one more thought.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One more thing... Have you been doing anything different in your business over the last year?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'm just looking here through these reports. It looks like out of the nineteen registered heating oil companies in the city your trucks have been getting hit three to one. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: So are you maybe doing something to bring this on yourself?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Like enter a new market?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am always trying to expand my business.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Of course. But I think you understand what I'm saying... there are always some markets that are more difficult than others to enter.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every new market is a difficult market. (MORE) 22  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my driver was assaulted and my truck and oil were stolen in broad daylight in front of fifteen toll collectors and six police officers yesterday. And yet no one saw anything. That is a problem... no?

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I have a lot of problems coming across my desk every day Mr. Morales.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks out in front of ANDREW.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel. Abel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (his words escape him)  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... let's not overreact. We don't even know what they are bringing against us. It could be total bullshit, and they are just trying to use us along the way. This isn't anything yet.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is working away on an adding machine in her office. is listening to the radio that sits behind her on the des We can see that she is in her comfort zone. ABEL enters.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go? 23   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DA... He said he's going to bring down charges on us next week.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know yet. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now they are just saying us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we exposed?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow standard industry practice on every front.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know what they are saying we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks down the long hallway and enters a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is sitting on the edge of the bed, waiting. His ja in bandages, and there are crutches sitting next to him, he looks much better than the previous day. They look at other intensely but say nothing. 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is helping JULIAN up the stairs. They struggle toget Finally they get to the top floor and stand outside apart number . JULIAN stops, not really wanting to open the doo front of his boss.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry this happened. Do you need anything else? (JULIAN nods no) If you do, you call the office... Okay then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to leave and walks back to the stairs.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL turns and looks at him.  JULIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I am ready to move into sales?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL thinks this through. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I'm not sure I will be able...  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN changes the subject.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get the truck back?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They took the load.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the sixth one?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventh... you get some rest. 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes out of the building and walks towards his car where a group of TOUGH-LOOKING KIDS in their early twenti are sitting, looking to see who is going to come and clai the brand new car. He walks right though them without bei overly aggressive but without a hint of being intimidated gets in and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is sitting in the barber chair getting a trim. Throu the window we see ARNOLD KLINE, a competitor of ABEL'S walking by. They see each other. ARNOLD KLINE comes into shop followed by a BODYGUARD. He sits down next to ABEL. conversation happens with them both looking at each other the mirror.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look who it is.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a touch off the side Jimmy. Not all of us are as lucky as Mr. Morales here in terms of keeping our hair.  BARBER JIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good looking man.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I am. So I hear congratulations are in order?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got yourself in contract over there.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are working on it.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty day close I hear, you better be.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are, thanks for your concern. 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBER JIMMY finishes ABEL, and he stands up to leave. AB has his back to KLINE as he pays. ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a couple of your trucks over in Rego Park the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This brings ABEL around to look at him square.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? When was that?  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple times.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a tough market. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father struggled for years before he broke in there.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any new market is a tough one. I'll see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks out of the shop and looks around. It is now da outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is jogging again but this time he is deep in the woo He runs along the road. We then hear a car coming from be him. The car noise then turns into more of a truck noise. stops and turns around as we see a large truck coming tow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets himself over to the side of the road. We have a slight fear it might hit him. But as it passes we see it' large moving truck. There's a second one following right behind it. 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the trucks pass it registers on ABEL's face. He cuts i a path in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks up to his house, and we see the moving trucks preparing to unload. ANNA gets out of her car with the ki and they run around and check out the house as ANNA direc the movers. ABEL comes up and stands next to her. They smile a protec smile at their new home. ABEL gives her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family sits around the table in candlelight. Th are eating takeout, but with a mismatch of formal and everyday tableware that has been unpacked. There are boxe all around them.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it has been a long road, and that not all of you wanted to do this, but thank you. For me... ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All six raise a glass.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast to our new home. It's as beautiful as my wife and daughters and as strong as me...(kids laugh) May we be happy, prosperous and safe here. Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is standing watching the game as he waits for his co to come out of the snack bar. Over his shoulder we hear..  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you made the move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL turns and sees PETER FORENTE standing there. He's in mid-forties, very well-dressed, and handsomely bald.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter... it's official as of yesterday. 28   COUNTER PERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. ABEL picks up his coffee, and they both walk back over to sideline together. Although they are standing a bit off t the side from everyone else.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I heard about your rig getting picked off again. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should probably get together to discuss this and go over some of the preventative measures that we've been taking. We haven't had an incident since November. It doesn't do any of us any good to have this kind of attention brought to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both stare out at the court for beat.

dialogues.speaker: PETER FORENTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I think I may have seen one of your new trucks the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: PETER FORENTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Out near here, at the Miller Road diner?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's possible.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver looked like a member of the Hitler Youth. I haven't seen a teamster that blond and blue-eyed since I was a kid.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's from Ohio. Played football. I like my drivers to fit in with the neighborhood...  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's new territory for you, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This brings them both back in to look at each other. 29   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just picked up a few new accounts over there. Weekend houses of some old clients from in the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER gives a bit of a stronger look. Then finally turns towards the field.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is yours? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look out.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the neighborhood. You should be proud. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proud?  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage is filled with boxes. ABEL stands in the middl a few that are partially unpacked. He has set up an old r in the corner of the garage, and it is playing a New York Giants football game. ABEL takes an object out of one of boxes and looks at it with significance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming from the main house we hear the doorbell ring. ABE oldest daughter, ANNIE, comes to the door of the garage.  ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. Mr. Walsh is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks around behind ANNIE to see ANDREW standing the He waves him into the garage. The boxes are stacked almos to the ceiling around them. 30   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for the dramatic drop in but your phone doesn't seem to be working.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not set up yet... So I am guessing this isn't good news here on a Sunday night. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... It looks like they are coming after us.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That describes many people at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slight smile.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The D.A.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad? ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still haven't seen it yet. But my guy in his office just gave me a heads up an hour ago. It's not good.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we exposed?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, a couple places probably.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple places?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hits ABEL. He thinks for a beat than goes over to th door to the house and calls for his wife.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna... Anna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait. She enters, she is a bit surprised to see ANDR in her garage.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew. 31   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna... sorry you've got no phone. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As of tomorrow I'll have my new radio hooked up though so you should be able to reach me wherever I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is making light of the situation, but as she looks at their faces she knows there is a problem.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The D.A. is going to bring down charges on us tomorrow.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know yet.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now they are just saying us.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we exposed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks at his wife. She looks at ANDREW.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow standard industry practice on every front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all give each other a long look, as this means they been bending the rules in several places, as do all their competitors.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what that means.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means we may have some accounting exposure where we have pushed things a little too far.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far? 32   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always told us to push until we couldn't push any further. Well, we may have hit that line. So we will handle it and move on.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL shoots her a stinging worried glance. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know what they are saying we did.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not get ahead of ourselves here. You have always followed standard industry practices. We aren't even sure what this is yet. I just wanted to make sure you had all the information I do. This is a badge of honor, it means we are big enough to give a shit about now. Don't worry. That sits for a beat.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming by Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL reaches into his pocket and takes out a remote for t automatic garage door opener. As it opens you can see the pride in his face as this remote is a fairly high-tech ne item. They all sit and watch as it opens the whole way th stops in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW is now standing outside in the driveway.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very impressive.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only cost him a year of the kid's tuition. 33   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one more thing. I got a call from the union... O'Leary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This grabs both their attention.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They've been getting word back from our drivers. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What word?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is real concern about their safety.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drivers are feeling unprotected. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they are.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think you should talk to them about it. Before it grows into something.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is lying in bed, awake. ANNA is as well. He is stari at the ceiling. Their dog is lying at the foot of the bed asleep as well. Eventually the dog wakes up and looks out towards the doorway. He growls ever so lightly. Then he stops, listens, and starts growling a little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA looks up ever so slightly.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing? 34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is now standing up to go look. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet... don't worry. It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA tries to go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks out of the bedroom and slowly heads down the h to his kids' rooms. He looks in each room and the CHILD i sleeping soundly with nothing out of place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he comes out of the last bedroom back into the hallway sees his dog standing at the top of the stairs looking do over the balcony into the living room. The dog is startin quietly growl once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL'S face goes from total comfort that his kids are saf total paranoia. He slowly walks down the hall. He stops o in his bedroom closet and grabs a mid-size baseball bat/b club. Now he is heading down the stairs with the club try not to freak himself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks down the stairs and the dog just stands at the top, still growling every now and then. ABEL comes into t living room and everything seems perfectly normal. He the relaxes and turns towards the dog.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. It's nothing. Come down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps his fingers and calls the dog. The dog finally c down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL now heads towards the kitchen in a relaxed state, bu then the dog starts growling again and looking out the windows next to the front door. ABEL comes over, he opens front door but the dog refuses to go out.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Oh come on. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL thinks he hears something. He clicks on the lights a pulls his bat back up into position. He heads outside. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes to the end of the front walk and there is noth The dog has now followed him outside and is slowly headin over to a area where a small exterior hallway leads to a entrance. It is dark. The dog starts barking and going cr ABEL slowly heads over to the covered passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hell now breaks lose. A BURGLAR, in all black, comes blasting out of the shadows. The dog tries to bite him as goes by. ABEL swings his club and hits BURGLAR square on shoulder but he keeps coming. He knocks ABEL over and run towards the driveway. ABEL is up and chasing after him fa than we expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pretty good moon out so we can see them runnin full throttle through the very thick woods. ABEL is keepi up with him and in fact may be gaining on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is still in his pajamas. He has a rage that has been building up inside him for a good two weeks that is now pouring out of him in the energy to chase this guy down. They come to the top of a small ravine which ABEL seems t know from his runs through the woods and ABEL takes a bit an easier/quicker path down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL now cuts him off at an angle and swings the bat at h legs. BURGLAR trips and goes flying. ABEL falls as he swi at him. They both sit on the ground for a beat. ABEL is exhausted. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brief look of panic comes across BURGLAR's face. Then h up again and running off into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL gets himself up and chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes out of the woods into the middle of the road, in the distance we see BURGLAR run up to a waiting van wi its lights and engine on. The guy gets into the passenger side of the van, and it peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is left standing in the middle of the road, barely a to breathe and holding the bat. 36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes walking back towards his front door. ANNA is standing with all the lights on and with the dog sitting to her. She looks at him in shock.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking to the dog) A lot of help you were.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look down at his bare feet. He has been in some kind of shock and hasn't even noticed that his bare feet cut up to pieces from running in the woods through the ic His feet are bleeding all over the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is in warrior mode. Any panic in her voice has disappeared, and she is speaking with a calm yet deadly seriousness. She is cleaning the cuts on his feet and put bandages on them as they talk.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was it?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, how am I supposed to know who it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a look.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him another look.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was just some punk, looking to rip us off.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you...  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch! If they had wanted to send a message he could have... and he didn't. 37   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like a message was sent loud and clear.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Don't get going on this. We are a big new house. He probably wanted the TV. He didn't have a gun, he had nothing. The alarm will be in on Monday. It was some kid. They aren't coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him with considerable concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in and starts kissing her. She holds still at fi then gives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is in a suit but is kneeling and almost lying on his back showing three SALES RECRUITS what they should be loo for. Another INSTRUCTOR looks on. We see ABEL in his elem He is a salesman.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you are looking for here is the opening to the burn chamber. Now at this point you have not tipped your hat in anyway. From the minute you walked in the house you should have been working to create an impression of total impartiality. But now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches over and opens the small door. A fire is burni inside. On cue the instructor hands ABEL a crisp clean wh handkerchief.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this door opens you begin to close. It must always be spotless. If they see you have ever done this before it is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes it and reaches up into a small exhaust chimney.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you do this and only this... You look down at the cloth and don't say a word... You just keep staring at the cloth and then you slowly just start shaking your head. Very very slowly and small. (MORE) 38  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look up at them. Just at the cloth. Then ABEL makes a small clicking noise.  INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear that noise... that's the noise.

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: What noise?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you are close... Then after sitting in silence way longer than is comfortable, you turn. And say "I'd love to run a few numbers for you. Is there somewhere more comfortable we could sit." They will almost always take you to the dining room table and will offer you something. And whatever it is you always take the fancy option.  INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you a coffee or tea? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tea please.  INSTRUCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have some homemade lemonade or a soda.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love a lemonade, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: Why?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, we are never going to be the cheapest option, so we have to be the best. And they want... no, need... to feel that you want the best too. That's why our trucks are the newest or cleanest, and our drivers are approachable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the woman who works behind the front desk (STAN FRONT DESK) comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: STANDARD FRONT DESK
dialogues.text: They need you. 39   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go, but the final point I will make is the hardest one. Once you have done the math and shown them what we can save them over the long haul through proper maintenance, you need them to sign. And the problem is by hiring you that means they are firing someone else. And that's never easy. So to get them over the line you need to close them. So when you show them the number look up at them both... and just stare at them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL begins staring at the recruits. He continues to star  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stare longer than you should. Because this is not a joke. You will only keep this job if you close. And that's not funny to you. And I am only interested in this company growing, and when it isn't I don't think it's funny at all. These people work very hard for their money and these other guys are ripping them off, treating them poorly, because they don't know... so when you look them in the eye you have to believe that we are better, and we are, but you will never do anything as hard as staring a person straight in the eye and telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL then does exactly that to them. And he holds it for long beat.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it was great to meet you. Welcome and I wish you luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks out of the room and straight into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a great high/low nature to the way ABEL runs the company. While he wears great suits and his trucks are impeccable, he does not waste money. So this room where t drivers have company meetings is very basic. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is filled with all of the drivers. There is a bi of a nervous energy in the room. It quiets as ABEL comes He stands aside.

dialogues.speaker: STANDARD FRONT DESK
dialogues.text: Trucks 16 through 23 you should be ready to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STANDARD FRONT DESK sees ABEL standing behind her, she stops. ABEL walks forward a few steps. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. First off, I picked up Julian yesterday and he is back home and doing much better. And I just wanted to make sure you are all aware that we are doing everything we can to deal with this situation. We are working with law enforcement, and they seem to be closing in on these guys. But, sadly these are the times we are living in and we must rise above them. So, on that front we have these. He puts one of the new radios on the dais. ANDREW comes i the room behind ABEL and stands.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These will be in every truck by the end of the week. Much to my wife's concern I spent some serious coin and we now have our own closed channel that shouldn't have any blackout areas. You will always be in contact with us. (a hand goes up in the BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR DRIVER EDDY
dialogues.text: I have heard that the union is considering recommending other more active options for us to consider. Do you know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks to ANDREW.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have been in constant contact with the union and they aren't considering any new course of action at this time. 41

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR DRIVER EDDY
dialogues.text: So this radio is what we got? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is walking back from the mailbox looking through the day's mail. As she approaches the house she looks up and the two younger daughters, ELIZABETH (6 years old) and CATHERINE (4 years old), playing in front of the house. CATHERINE comes out from under a bush near the side door something in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA looks back down at the mail. As she gets closer to t house we see a look of concern come across her face. The then turns to one of complete horror but as she gets clos to CATHERINE she tries to control her emotions.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine... Catherine. Katie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops the mail. And goes right up to her daughter. CATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ANNA comes up to CATHERINE we now see that the little is holding a large very real looking handgun in her littl hands. ANNA is besides herself.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this? Catherine where did you find this?  CATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl points over towards the bushes near the s door where LOUIS SERVIDIO was hiding and got hit the nigh before.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little girl walks over to bushes and kneels down.  CATHERINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just sitting right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA turns to the middle daughter, ELIZABETH. 42   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see this? ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she went under there to get that ball and came out with it.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria! ANNA yells towards in the house.  ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA walks towards the front door to retrieve the NANNY MARIA.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria!  ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, is it real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is sitting down at his desk. ANNA comes to the door. gets his attention and then walks right up to the desk. S puts the handgun down right in front of him.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gun... It's a gun Abel.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get it?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your youngest daughter found it in the bushes outside our front door. She was playing with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is totally speechless.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's loaded... with the safety off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sits like a bomb in the room. 43   ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those weren't kids looking to rip off our TV Abel, that was a fucking goon with a loaded gun looking in our windows! What the hell is going on here?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that. I'll take care of this. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right we will. Who is this?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I will take care of it.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean you will take care of it. This isn't a brick through our car window or some other cute little warning that I've put up with in the past. This is your daughter playing with a loaded gun! He turns back quickly. And stares at her.  ABEL (YELLS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly walks back across the room and picks up the gun His hand shows a shake ever so slightly as he touches it.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me deal with this.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better. Because you won't like what's going to happen once I start getting involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This causes him to stop in his tracks. He turns very seriously.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not to tell your father about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at him with a tinge of a smile. 44   ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear me. ANNA'S look changes and she understands.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW comes to the door and knocks. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk with you both?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found a gun outside our front door. Somebody left it there last night.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA looks over to ANDREW letting him know her disgust. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around then closes the door behind him and gets their attention.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not good... It's bad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a folder containing the formal indictment an hands it to ABEL.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's a fourteen count indictment. Most of it is crap. Piggyback issues. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ANDREW keeps talking, trucks go rumbling by behind the

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The first three counts are where we start to have real issues. They know what's going on in this industry. They say we are rigging scales and under-reporting income. We don't know what they have or how they got it. But no matter how they got it, it's a problem. 45   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That truck just went out filthy. ABEL looks out the window as a truck leaves the yard.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel!  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to owe them some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This brings him back.    ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends on a bunch of factors. But that's an accounting question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look to ANNA

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And there is one other thing. The bank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hits ABEL.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to sit down with them immediately. I set a dinner. We need you both there to lay everything out and be totally up- front. This shouldn't be a problem. Lord knows they've given money to bigger crooks than us. But I don't want us hiding anything from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL does not like this joke.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get home and start going through our set of books. How far back are they going?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like all the way back to when you bought out Anna's father.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get into it. 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out the window and sees a Cadillac pull in.. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is O'Leary doing here?.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel looks to ANDREW.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been wanting to talk to you for days. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL gets up to go out. As ANDREW shuffles to leave ANNA STOPS HIM:  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew can I talk to you for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL leaves and they stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you Bill?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ok. Can't say I'm used to making house calls like this anymore though.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have come to see you.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright. You've got bigger things to worry about. (Long pause) So, I can't have this situation with your guys continuing.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guys.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your drivers. 47   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I would love you to help on this. Because I can't have it going on any longer either.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let them protect themselves, that would stop all this very quickly. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I respectfully disagree.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are picking on your men because they are just sitting there... weak.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are taking shots at me because I am growing, expanding, getting stronger not weaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This frustrates Bill because he knows ABEL is right. He t a new tack. BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quite simple for me: I can't have my drivers getting hit like this. It looks like I can't protect them.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it appears that you can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little too sharp for the head of the NYC teamst taste.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can. And will. Because of all my job descriptions that is the one I consider most sacred.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. But these are truck drivers, not soldiers, this will lead to chaos.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will stop immediately.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it won't. 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He resets, again. BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem to be under pressure from many sides right now... which I understand. Trust me I understand. So let me think this through. But whatever decision I make on this, it stands. Those men show up every morning for you because I tell them to. It's important for you to realize that these are very dangerous times, and we need to adapt. It's not like when we were driving.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes the weak man is the stronger man if he has the right tools.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may seem that way... but if you are weak eventually it will show... it always does. And if you want this to all be behind us, help me find out who is doing this. You know a lot of people, and that would be the most help to me.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not always as simple as it appears.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that's true.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is... well, I got to get going.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'LEARY walks over to ANDREW as he is getting in his car.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did that go? 49   BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not well. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels very strongly about this.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he fully understands it.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to understand?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's illegal.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not illegal if I say it isn't. My responsibility is to provide safe and timely passage of goods and products into and around this city. And because of this situation it is appearing to those whose opinions I care about that I can't do my job. That can not and will not continue.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So talk to him. You need to protect yourself. This is very serious. Just know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW thinks this through.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would this work?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm not even sure exactly what you are suggesting.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me with this? 50   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every driver in your fleet gets a handgun.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a permit? O'LEARY nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Friday.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the permits legit?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends what they do with it. If they kill their wife with them, then no. Then that is a very fake permit, and I'll walk away very quickly. But they just need to show that they are defending themselves, and this will stop.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking know...  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is struggling through the boxes in the garage. She m some things and then finds what she is looking for. A pil about nine matching file boxes that are all labeled the s It is their off the books bookkeeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The library is filled with custom made bookshelves that a still waiting to be filled. There is a large desk sitting the corner that hasn't been fully unpacked yet. 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA comes in struggling carrying the file boxes from the garage, she piles them on the desk. She looks around her feet at the pile, it's literally the skeletons from her closet. She resets, walks over to the window to look out over her new beautiful home. Then she turns back at the pile of boxes that hold their past and their future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Standard Oil DRIVER steers his truck down the driveway. he approaches the end he sees a massive bulk oil truck of of their competitors parked blocking the exit of the driveway. He stops his truck and gets out warily. He look around. No one is in the cab of the truck. But he sees a small note taped to the window. It reads: "Engine trouble back later... Fuck you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone starts ringing. ANNA gets up from her work and answers it. We stay on her as she gets the news. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face fills with building anger as she hears.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA hangs up the phone and walks over to the window and looks out and over at the other main wing of her new beautiful home. Then she turns back and looks at the pile boxes that hold their past and their future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'LEARY walks over to ANDREW as he is getting in his car.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
