dialogues.text: How did that go?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not well.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels very strongly about this. 52   BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he fully understands it.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to understand? ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's illegal.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not illegal if I say it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This takes ANDREW back a step.

dialogues.speaker: BILL O'LEARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My responsibility is to provide safe and timely passage of goods and products into and around this city. And because of this situation it is appearing to those whose opinions I am concerned with, that I can't do that right now. That can not and will not continue.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So talk to him. You need to protect yourself. As a company.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will try to talk with him.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is very serious. Just know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW WALSH thinks this through.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would this work?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm not even sure exactly what you are suggesting. 53   BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me with this? ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every driver in your fleet gets a handgun. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a permit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'LEARY nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Friday.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the permits legit?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends what they do with it. If they kill their wife with them, then no. Then that is a very fake permit, and I'll walk away very quickly. But they just need to show that they are defending themselves, and this will stop.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW comes to the door. ABEL is staring out the window looks up as ANDREW sits down.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just got another truck.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was driving? 54   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alright?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drivers' security aside... this shit is starting to have a very significant financial effect on us here. It can't continue.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your talk? (nothing) I spoke with him after. He's going to keep going `til he gets the answer he's looking for.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I wouldn't do it. They sit for a long beat.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure we are in a position to say that.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW looks around. He's getting paranoid.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go for a walk?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really serious with this, this is what it's come to, walking around outside like fucking gangsters?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am and it is. 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throughout this conversation ABEL is walking over to a section of the yard where WORKERS are loading some sort o additive chemical to the fuel trucks.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is looking like we must do this.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets a little personal.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will shut you down.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men, they work for me. These trucks they drive, the customers they serve. They are here because we built this.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true, until its not. And the last person in the world right now that we need working against us is the president of the fucking teamsters. This company is out of business in a month if he gets these guys to walk. We are running out of cash.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you even talking about here?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The union provides a handgun and a permit to every one of the drivers. And they think this whole thing is over in a week.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men are fucking truck drivers. This is insane. You know who is gonna get it in the end here, me. This comes back to me.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does either way.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing it. 56   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you put everything at risk to stand by that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL thinks this through.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be the end of everything I have worked for. If one of these guys shoots somebody it's me they will bring down for it...I'll talk to him... And we need to close this deal. We can't stay like this any longer. We must close on that property... We are so weak right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now standing on top of one of the trucks tanks a worker pours the additive into the tank. The container sa "GREEN DYE #7" on it. ABEL looks down as it flows in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up and looks out across the fence at the contai property.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want this so badly? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I have my entire savings at risk with this deposit. It is everything.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean. Why did you want it so badly in the first place? It was a risk... always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL thinks this through.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know? Have you ever thought about it?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've thought about it every day for the last five years. This place was sitting over that fence mocking....  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean have you ever thought about that place... (MORE) 57

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean have you ever thought why you want it so badly? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks to him in a sincere way wanting him to answer ANDREW just waits. Finally.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you are asking and no... I never ask myself why I do this. It just feels right... wanting to be bigger feels better. It feels right.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very simple.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this he gives him a deadly serious look.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It is. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take these risks...  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when necessary.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get going, we need them to show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA leads the boys to the table, and we see a whole new to her. She is going to get this done. As they approach t table we see two BANKERS stand to greet them. The Bank President, ARTHUR LEWIS, and Bank VP IAN THOMPSON.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna, you look amazing as always.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. 58   ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. Do you know Ian Thompson? One of our new VP's.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all shake hands and sit. The WAITER comes over.  WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what can I get you to drink?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward laughter.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wine list please.  WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how are you? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been better... but we are good.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I heard about that... if you stay in business long enough it's bound to happen eventually.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's exactly right. And we wanted to sit down with you tonight to make sure we were being totally up-front with everything that is going on and make sure that you understand the nature of the complaints and are comfortable that it is not going to affect our business in an adverse way.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a chance to look over the outline that I sent over?  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we did. 59   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully it made clear that even in a worst case situation we will pay off any and all fines and be able to move forward with very comfortable capital on hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL jumps in taking some offense.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you should know Arthur that this man has been digging through our industry for over two years looking for anything he can find. And as you know probably better than anyone, having worked with some of our competitors the thought that he would have singled us out is ridiculous. It reeks of everything that is wrong with this city right now. We run a fair and clean business and follow every standard industry practice and I will fight `til my last day to prove that... This silences the table for a long beat.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL holds up his finger and points at ARTHUR across the table to make his point.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Don't think for a moment that I am going to allow this mess to interfere with our plan to grow. We need to know you are standing by us.

dialogues.speaker: BANK VP IAN THOMPSON
dialogues.text: Yes, what is it with this piece of property that you find so integral or that can't be put off `til after this legal matter is dealt with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is a little taken aback by this comment. It goes aga everything that comes naturally to him as a person. ANNA ANDREW know this and are concerned he might go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL thinks it through. 60   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a very good question. This property gives us many things... firstly direct access to the river. So I can bring in fuel directly from any provider in the world straight to my tanks, then it has over 10 million gallons of storage capacity, so I can buy in the summers when my price is low and sell to my customers and most importantly some of my competitors when the price is high. I won't just drive trucks anymore... I will control my fate... but the real answer to your question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now ABEL stares right at IAN THOMPSON.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is that when it feels scary to jump Ian... that is exactly when you must jump... or you risk ending up staying in the same place your whole life... and that I can't do. IAN THOMPSON awkwardly laughs a bit as ABEL just stays de serious staring right at him. Finally.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've always been there with you and know that we will continue to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is driving, and ANNA sits in silence looking out the passenger window. They are heading along the main backwoo road to their house.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that went about as well as could be expected.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Arthur is a good man.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they will close?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as he says this a deer comes running out in front of them. ABEL tries to slam on the brakes but isn't able to in time. The car hits the deer and it careens over the windshield and on to the road behind the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues to slam on the brakes and comes to a complet stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both catch their breath and look around to make sure they are both okay. Then they look back at the deer. It i laying on the road but is still breathing.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... you need to go put it out of its misery.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it. We can't just leave it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL gets out of the car and looks at his smashed hood. H then walks back and approaches the animal. It is laying o the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes right up to it and stares into its eyes. It star back at him. ABEL walks back to the car.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it dead?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you need...  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches down to open the trunk.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? 62   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting the tire iron! This whole situation has stressed them out and they are o edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL goes to the trunk and gets out the large wrench. He walks back over to the deer. He bends down next to it and stares into its eye again. ABEL is thinking back on something, or many things. He makes a small starting movement like he is going to hi over the head but he stops himself. He can't quite do it. Then he sits with the animal a beat longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come in very close to ABEL and see his hand is struggl to deliver the blow. Just as he grips the tire iron waiting... BANG! BANG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two very loud GUNSHOTS go off from right over his shoulde He ducks for cover then slowly turns behind him. ANNA sta there holding a small-yet-powerful Saturday Night Special style handgun. Smoke is still rising from the end of the pistol. The deer is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her dumbfounded... where did she get this gun She gives him a look. Then turns and walks back to the ca He stays and struggles to get the deer out of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is sitting in the car waiting. We hear ABEL'S footst as he approaches the open driver's side door. He gets in without saying a word. We stay with them as they drive on silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and ABEL walks in. ANNA is already in the house talking with NANNY MARIA who's been baby-sitting.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Maria, sorry we are a bit late. They were fine?  NANNY MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. All is good.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, thank you. We'll see you in the morning then. 63   NANNY MARIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. NANNY MARIA comes around the corner and passes ABEL who i just standing in the living room. He only gives her a nod ANNA is standing on the other side of the room just waiti in silence as well. NANNY MARIA goes over to the closet a gets her coat out and puts it on. The tension is building like a kettle. Finally NANNY MARIA gets herself together walks out and as the door shuts they come immediately at other.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... what?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then... what is this gun?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I wasn't going to just continue to stand around and let these people come and get me and my children. So unlike you who seems to be totally comfortable just standing around like some... fucking pussy... I did something about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is slightly stammering at this point, not quite sure what to do. They are still standing on opposite sides of room from each other. He just waits... finally.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get it?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where I got it.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a permit? 64   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. This sets him off. He comes walking across the room at he if he might hit her. He gets closer and closer.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be a bigger fucking idiot than I even thought. You are trying to protect your children? Protect them? Do you have any idea what happens if you get caught using that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is now standing right over her.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dress yourself up in these fancy clothes, and look at you here in your mansion. I've given you everything you could possibly want but you still can't stop thinking like the Brooklyn corner-store gangster's daughter that you are.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've given me? You? Are you delusional? Do you even understand how ridiculous that makes you sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are really going at it now. He tries to grab her pur which she still has over her shoulder. They struggle for  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this thing? Let me see it.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see it. Is this going to make you safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that he uses brute force, probably hurting her arm, she doesn't let on. He takes the purse from her. He opens and takes out the small gun.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who uses guns like this? (HE SCREAMS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whores! 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, she SLAPS him across the face. They just stare each other for a very long time. ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trap... and you are walking right into it... You need to get that thing out of our house.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to protect us. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are twelve SEVEN-YEAR-OLDS sitting around the dinin room table yelling "Happy Birthday" to one of the Morales daughters as she blows out the candles. A large GROUP of PARENTS surround the table.  GROUP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday! Just as ELIZABETH blows out the candles the doorbell ring NANNY MARIA heads to the front door. The camera stays wit the party. NANNY MARIA comes back into the room and stand behind her, we see a POLICE OFFICER holding some kind of clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks over quickly trying not to create a scene. He leads the POLICE OFFICER back over to the front door. The PARENTS certainly notice and start stirring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL leads the OFFICER outside, and as he looks up he see that his driveway is packed with four police cars, some unmarked and there are about five OFFICERS waiting to com into the house.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. But as you can see this is a terrible time for us. I am having my daughter's birthday party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is trying to remain calm and not lose his temper. 66   POLICE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand and I apologize, I do. But this is a warrant and we need to gain complete access to the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other just as ANNA comes to the door. sees the scene in her driveway.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  POLICE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go check something.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is seething and can only manage a slight nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they look across the driveway they see the OFFICER tal to someone. The officer shifts out of the way and they se is talking to ASSISTANT D.A. LAWRENCE.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill this guy. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is trying to get his attention quietly.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and they look at each other. She signals towards library and they share a knowing, concerned glance.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods and heads down the path towards the police and LAWRENCE. Abel heads back in the doorway.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria. Keep the kids playing for a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA walks up to the LAWRENCE.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lawrence is it? 67

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Yes. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna Morales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out her hand to shake his with a smile.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak with you for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (thinks, then) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk away from the others down the driveway a stretc  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you and your men have a job to do here. But we are in the middle of a seven-year-old's birthday party.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I understand, and I'm sorry. But we are coming in. She turns a little on him.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a problem, as we have nothing to hide from you. It's just that, we recently moved to this area, and there are twenty guests in our house... please... can you give me five minutes so we can ask everyone to leave calmly before you come into my home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks this through.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You can get them out of the house.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes down the hall carrying file boxes and brings t out onto the deck. ANNA comes out onto the deck as he is looking over the edge. 68   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the last few out.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got three minutes.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on out there.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guests are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL tries to speak but can only shake his head. Finally jumps over the edge and she starts handing boxes down to He then stops again.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we even need to be doing this? What exactly are we hiding here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks this through.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want them going through all this before I've had a chance to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera is now on the ground level with ABEL.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the last one. Get back out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks around for a place to stash them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL exhales then takes three of the boxes and sneaks off into the woods. We follow him as he struggles. Finally he gets to a small clearing and starts to stack them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is standing out front trying to hand out goody bags to maintain pleasantries with the parents as they leave. 69   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming. Here you go. Bye, Rebecca. Thanks. I'm sorry. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the last one goes she looks up at the ASST. DA to gi him the all-clear. But as she does she gives him a look t could kill. The police file into the house in front of he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL has placed the load of file boxes underneath the dec and is putting the last one in place. He sits down on the pile and looks out into the woods in sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA is looking around the house as the cops search throu everything. She seems oddly calm. She decides that they a being respectful and heads out into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA walks outside and stands, waiting. LAWRENCE comes ou the house and stands near her. They wait.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is probably one that you are going to regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAWRENCE looks at her trying to figure her out.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband is a very honorable man. Coming on a Saturday? It's very aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: This is standard.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I know you think you are just doing your job. But we are not what you think we are. And you have embarrassed him in front of his family and friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a long, almost scary look. 70

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I think I know your father. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. My husband is not my father. Not even close. So if I were you I would start treating us with a little more respect or he'll make it our only mission to ruin you. This was very disrespectful... and you are not going to find a fucking thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that she walks back towards the house as the POLICE start filing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is sitting at his desk looking out the window as the trucks come and go. As he looks across the lot he sees JU coming walking across towards the locker room. A smile crosses ABEL'S face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ABEL comes out into the hallway SALES STUDENT ALEX is walking by his door. ABEL stops to check in.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: Good. A bit nervous. I'm heading out on my first calls alone today.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do great. Remember... When you get them there. Hold the eye contact longer than you would like... but you watch what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives him a big smile and a pat on the back and sends on his way.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes into the room and JULIAN is getting ready. 71   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is good to see you back here. You look good.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is very quiet and timid. He is missing a spark.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready to get back to work?  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you heading?  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bulk delivery to Chase. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manhattan. That's a cakewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN does not agree. ABEL can no longer ignore his youn protege's concern.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel very vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL jumps on this.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... Because you are. We all are. Someone came to my house a couple nights ago to rob me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large truck rumbles by and they wait for silence to ret  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to chase them away... but really there's nothing I can do. I am vulnerable. We all are. They can come back tonight. But to succeed and be great you must keep going back. And I know what all these guys want to be doing. But it doesn't make you any safer. (MORE) 72  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they will come after me with everything they have... So this is what we do. And the times will get better and safer. They will. So go. You are strong just by going. Stronger in fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN looks down at the ground, shuffles a foot, then cl into the waiting truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALES STUDENT ALEX gets out of his car and walks up to th front door. He is nervous. He builds the courage and fina rings the doorbell. He waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and a nice lady in her 40's comes to the d

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: Hi Mrs. Rose. I'm Alex with Standard Heating Oil, we had an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROSE
dialogues.text: Of course, come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is back behind the wheel and trying to convince himself that all is well. He is making a difficult right to get onto the 59th Street Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALES STUDENT ALEX is now leaning down on the ground next the furnace doing the exact same procedure that ABEL did the training session.

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: Now as I mentioned on the phone this is a 17 point inspection that will help us to decipher if our maintenance plan will improve your efficiency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then he brings out the white cloth and wipes the ins of the exhaust. And he then does the pause and the look j as he was taught. He holds the look for a very long beat. hear a door opening upstairs and then feet walking across floor. 73

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROSE
dialogues.text: Oh good, it's my husband.

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is up on the bridge moving slowly along with the traffic. He is getting paranoid. Looking in his rearview mirror. Looking around. But there is nothing. No one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SALES KID is still on his knees next to the furnace a feet come into frame coming down the basement steps. Slow the HUSBAND comes into frame.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROSE
dialogues.text: Here he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SALES KID stands up to shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: Mr. Rose, I am Alex with Standard Heating Oil.  HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: I was just showing your wife the results of my inspection. Should we head upstairs to run through some numbers?  HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I just had one question about our exhaust chimney. Would you be willing to take a look.

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: Of course.  HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just outside on the other side of this wall here.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROSE
dialogues.text: I'm going to head up. Can I get you something to drink? Coffee... tea? 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KID gives himself an ever-so-tiny smile.

dialogues.speaker: SALES STUDENT ALEX
dialogues.text: Tea would be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man walks over to a back basement door and opens it. ushers the SALES KID through.  HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the SALES KID goes through the door a massive fist of SOMEONE who has been waiting on the other side of the doo comes swinging into frame and pounds the side of our KID' head. Knocking him out instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is close to getting off the bridge and is starting feel better. Just as the traffic in front of him starts t clear up, out of the corner of his eye he sees something. In his side-view mirror he sees LOUIS SERVIDIO getting ou a random car behind him. His heart starts racing. He look over in the other mirror and there is THUG #2 walking up. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN thinks for a second then reaches for the CB RADIO.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cathy! They are coming again. Over. Help. Help. On Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then fumbles the CB and it drops to the floor of the c He looks up into the mirrors again and sees that they are still coming for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera now comes in tight on his face and he pauses f long second, and he then makes his decision. He reaches u his seat and takes out a handgun. He doesn't really seem know what he is doing with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he opens the door of the truck and gets out. He aims gun at LOUIS SERVIDIO walking towards him. LOUIS SERVIDIO sees him and is very surprised and stops.  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Take it easy there. 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances over at THUG #2. JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from me!  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in the cars behind the truck are starting to honk. Then LOUIS SERVIDIO gives a nod signal to THUG #2 who is the other side of the truck, and JULIAN'S gun fires by mistake. It totally misses THUG #2. He jumps out of the w and is hiding behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS SERVIDIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watch it now, man. You're going to hurt someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is now in a total state of panic. He is hiding bac front of the truck. The three men are basically doing a s motion, very stressful hide-and-seek around the truck. Th two THUGS now have their guns out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The honking has now reached a total insane level as traff is backing up. Then THUG #2 makes one last play to take the truck. He tr to climb into the cab and JULIAN goes into a rage. He qui fires three shots, missing THUG #2 with each one, but tha forces LOUIS SERVIDIO to shoot two shots of his own at JU to protect THUG #2. They miss as well, but one hits the m section of the tank and a small but steady stream of heat oil starts pouring out onto the roadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then we hear sirens starting to come closer in the background. This adds a new element.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS SERVIDIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you?  THUG #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here.  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?  THUG #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is just trying to decide what to do next. The sire are now getting much closer. 76   LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the car! THUG #2 takes off. This now leaves JULIAN and LOUIS SERVI all alone with the police coming. As JULIAN is hiding, tr to figure out what to do next, LOUIS SERVIDIO goes runnin him. As he does:

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS SERVIDIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Run for it! JULIAN thinks for a second and then runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN runs all along the bridge and then sees LOUIS SERV run through a small door into the body of one of the four massive stone anchor structures that hold up the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once he is inside, there's another set of stairs. He lock the door behind him and starts racing down the stairs. As heads down he hears someone just in front of him. He stops and looks down the center column of the stairs a looking up at him about three flights away is LOUIS SERVI  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there he is. Had to be the hero eh?  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't just let us take the truck.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is screaming in a fit of panic at this point.  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man relax... calm down. Did they see you come in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN can't stop breathing very heavy at this point.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. 77   LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they or not? He thinks.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, there's a door down here about four more flights. Don't go out there, that's the street. Go down about two more flights after that and you'll come out below the bridge. They won't be there.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then LOUIS SERVIDIO's head disappears and we can hear his feet flying down the steps again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN thinks for a beat, then he starts off down the sta again as well. The camera stays right where it was as JUL heads down out of sight. We just hear the sounds of his f getting lower and lower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN comes to the first door and looks at it. We can he sirens in the distance on the other side of the door. He keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down two more flights, just as he said, there is another doorway. JULIAN walks up to that door very carefully. He listens on the other side but doesn't hear anything but h own breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we hear the door back up top fly open. JULIAN then quietly opens the door in front of him and right in front his face is a woman in full jogging clothes running by hi He looks around, and after a second to get himself orientated, we see he's on a riverfront esplanade where t are many people jogging and walking, enjoying the evening 78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN looks at his hand and realizes he is still holding gun out in the open. He puts it away and then looks up at bridge that is hovering above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows he left his life as he knew it up on that bridge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the black we begin to hear the rumble of a very larg truck. It gets louder and louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see that SALES STUDENT ALEX is inside a massive, e construction dumpster. And as he looks around, we realize is on the back of a truck that is currently driving prett fast. With each bump that the truck goes over the noise inside the dumpster is deafening. As the KID comes to his senses he tries to stand up. As he does, we see that the sides of the dumpster are at least eight feet tall and th interior is very slick without anything to grab or stand He is trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the truck goes over another huge bump and comes a stop. It idles for a minute then begins backing up. It stops. A warning, beeping alarm is heard, and finally one of the dumpster begins rising. As it gets higher and high our KID tries to hold himself back, but he begins to slid towards the low end. As he does he sees that the end that is heading towards is on a hinge and it is starting to sw open. Finally the thing is at such an angle that he can't hold on any longer and he slides towards the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he falls out he/we see that he's being dumped over the edge of a cliff of some sort. He falls probably 10-12 fee into a pile of garbage. As he gathers himself and tries t stand, we see he is standing in a massive landfill. He lo around as the truck pulls away. He's left totally alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is led by a MAID into an indoor tennis court. The ho is massive and designed like an English Country Estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ABEL walks up we see PETER FORENTE on the court playin against an automatic tennis ball machine. He is in full tennis whites as he hammers the balls back at the machine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL approaches the court and watches for a beat. 79   PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pretty cool machine, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL nods.

dialogues.speaker: PETER FORENTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was paying a guy five bucks an hour to do this with me last year. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This causes PETER to look up and see the serious look on ABEL's face. He hits one last shot and walks a little clo to ABEL. The machine is still hitting balls behind PETER.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak with you.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see that. PETER walks over to the machine and unplugs it. He points over towards the chairs courtside. He and ABEL sit down.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has gotten out of control... There was a guy with a gun at my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL lets this sit for a minute, and he is intently readi PETER's face. He hopes not, but he is judging to see if P had anything to do with all these attacks. PETER just loo back at him with a very strong poker face.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife and children were home at the time.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everyone okay?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I managed to chase him off.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry, that must have been scary... what can I do. 80   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know who is doing this. PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel...  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one thing to come after my trucks and drivers... and to steal from me... but this... it's different.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever dealt with anything like this?  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you met my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both smile. His father is an old-school gangster.

dialogues.speaker: PETER FORENTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A bunch of thugs invaded our home when I was a baby... My mother was there with us... My brother remembers it. Nothing happened. They were trying to scare my father. They ended up just leaving and we never found out who it was. But after that we moved to a fortress just like this. And those guys who let you in. They are here to shoot anyone who isn't invited.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I refuse to live my life that way. I won't do it... I am going to ask for a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look out and think it through a bit.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone with more than 20k of storage. Can I count on you being there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER looks away for a long beat. 81   PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... When are you closing on the terminal?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monday.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold that... it's not done yet... you may be hearing from me. (Trailed by an awkward laugh.)  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL stands up ready to go.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for seeing me. I want more than this...  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do. My father is in jail... as you know. And I have always wanted to conduct myself differently than he did.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost exclusively, yes. But I know why he did what he did. Because at the time it's easier.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is. You are a good man. I will see what I can find out. This isn't good for any of us.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is walking across the beautifully-manicured driveway and as he gets nearer to his car he starts to hear the ma that is coming from the CB radio in the front seat. As he gets closer he gets more and more details.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DISPATCHER V.O.
dialogues.text: Where is the truck now? RESPONDING DRIVER V.O. It's still on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DISPATCHER V.O.
dialogues.text: Is it still leaking oil?

dialogues.speaker: RESPONDING DRIVER V.O.
dialogues.text: No. They have stopped the leak.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DISPATCHER V.O.
dialogues.text: Did it reach the river?

dialogues.speaker: RESPONDING DRIVER V.O.
dialogues.text: Some did.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DISPATCHER V.O.
dialogues.text: How many shots were fired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL now slams open the door and gets into the driver sid and picks up the microphone.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne it's me. What are you talking about... what shots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera now comes around to the outside of the car loo back at ABEL through the windshield. The mansion is loomi in the background. We see ABEL'S face react as he hears t news of the incident on the bridge. The camera pulls back ABEL'S face goes totally cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks into an almost empty courtroom. LAWRENCE is packing up his things at the front of the room. They catc each others eye. ABEL makes his way forward as everyone e leaves. They look at each other for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I heard. 83   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to make sure you know that we had nothing to do with this. It's not the way I do business. In fact I have been warning my men against doing this sort of thing. It is terrible for me.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: It's not good... for either of us. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: In my job we use whatever leverage we can gain, as I'm sure you do in your business. It's an ongoing investigation, and it will be just one piece of many. So while I appreciate you coming here... I have nothing I can tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAWRENCE looks around the room thinking while ABEL says nothing, just waiting.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What a fucking mess this place is... Do you know where he is?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... but I'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You should. And when you do, bring him to us. A situation like this, happening in such a dangerous and public way, within an industry I'm charged with cleaning up. It's very bad for me... professionally speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other one last time. ABEL gets the mess

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALES STUDENT ALEX is walking down the street looking terrible. His clothes are ruined by garbage, and he is scared. As he approaches his car his face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car has a two-by-four slammed through the shattered windshield. 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops dead in his tracks and then carefully looks arou and scans the street looking for anything. It is eerily empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL pulls up in his car and the gate starts to open. As does we see ARTHUR LEWIS standing waiting next to his car ABEL pulls in next to him and gets out. There is an overriding, almost unsettling calm to this conversation.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to come and talk to you in person... We aren't going to be able to show up for you on Monday. We can't do the loan.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to let you know as soon as possible so that you could try to put something else together.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming... This is not right.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do?  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... The loan review committee met this afternoon and won't meet again for two weeks.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are aware of the position this is putting me in?  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. 85   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid off my first loan to you eleven years ago.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember the term on that loan? ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had seven years to pay you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both nod knowing what's coming next.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how long it took me to pay you off?  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven months? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six and a half.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put 40 percent down as a deposit on this. It's all we had.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You now have three separate serious pending legal cases against you. One with sixteen counts of misconduct ranging from fraud to tax evasion. And then in the middle of our meeting today I get a report saying you had armed your entire fleet of drivers which led to a shoot-out on the 59th Street Bridge.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of it is true.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be. 86   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May? They look at each other.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does matter, that you know we didn't do this.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do... I do. But it doesn't matter, I can't do anything. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL's demeanor shifts.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find it.  ARTHUR LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banker gets into his car and backs out. The gate open and he drives out. Just as it is about to close it starts opening again. SALES STUDENT ALEX drives in with his car trashed. He pulls up and gets out of the car looking at A He knows what has happened and is crushed. Neither of the say a word, finally ABEL gives the kid a cautious but meaningful hug around the shoulder and leads him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks into the room and ANNA is sitting at the large dining table smoking a cigarette inside. She has been cry  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's horrible.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking for him.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they haven't gotten the other guys? 87   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'm not... They're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets her attention. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that ABEL walks out of the room and heads up the sta to his bedroom. When he's halfway up the stairs she stops him.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does that mean?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means we need to find the money somewhere else.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have two days!  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is driving ANNA'S car towards the city. ANNA is in t passenger seat and the three DAUGHTERS are in the back. A and ABEL do not look any better. In fact there is now a t of anger mixed into the sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DAUGHTERS are arguing about who's taking up too much in the back seat.  DAUGHTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.  DAUGHTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You move. 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA turns and snaps at them a bit. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. I've told you guys not to push it this morning, this is not the morning to be doing this... but since the second you all woke up. It's this, it's that. Just stop. The world does not revolve around you! This shuts them up for a beat. ABEL is seething. But then ELIZABETH (middle) nudges ANNIE (oldest) so she gives CATHERINE (youngest) a good hit. ANNA sees it and freaks.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it Annie we've told you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before ANNA can get the full sentence out ABEL suddenly p the car off the side of the highway into the grass. Every in the car is taken aback. The road is a smaller scenic highway not some eight lane affair but this whole sequenc still plays out with the menacing roar of the cars going right next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL gets out of the car and slams the door. He walks aro the back of the car as the cars fly by them on the highwa He goes around to his oldest daughter's door and pulls AN from the car. They stand behind the car and go at it with traffic flying by. ABEL is louder than he has been in the entire film. He is losing it from all the pressure but hi daughter bears the brunt.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are thirteen years old. What are you doing? Your mother asks you an hour ago to help her get out of the house smoothly and you are acting like an...  ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck you!  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is looking around for someone to help him and witnes this. He then switches, he has had enough and gets right in her face. 89   ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure who the hell you think you are, but you don't talk to me that way... You are in serious danger of becoming a rich little spoiled brat and I can tell you from experience there is nothing worse in the world than a rich little girl who thinks the whole world revolves around her. ANNIE is yelling back over the traffic.  ANNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world revolves around me? Me! What about her? And what about you? You're both so totally obsessed with your stupid business. You walk around like you are saving the world but what are you doing... nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stings. He now changes his tone to a quiet low roar. he can't keep quiet and by the end of the line he is yell again. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off I don't walk around like I am saving anything. I chose this business because I looked at the world and said `What's the last bill people stop paying every month when they are low on cash?' `Cause that's a business I want to be in. `Cause failure wasn't much of an option for me. I lived in reality... not whatever this world is you are living in. And we help people stay warm... which isn't all that bad. (now he is yelling again) Maybe you've got grander ambitions but for now this is how you eat, sleep, and get all dressed up... So you better shape the fuck up and NEVER speak to me like this again!  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look over and ANNA is standing there. A calmnes suddenly falls down on all of them. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All five of them are sitting in the car, sadness prevails

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves slowly across a dark hallway. We hear th sounds of a manual adding machine grinding away. As we co through the doorway we see ANNA MORALES sitting at her de in a pool of light from the desk lamp. She is deep in it crunching numbers. Finally ABEL walks into the doorway, h looks exhausted.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up with a small but sweet smile.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it coming?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made it to 1975.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a good year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA gives a slight look that the numbers may not totally support that claim.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it was for me...how is it?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure yet... but it's not as bad as they are saying it is... Turns out I kinda knew what I was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give each other a slight smile.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got us a three more days... and one piece... from Saul. But we're still about a million short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other with concern. 91   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to see your little brother?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Peter? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they look at each other ABEL  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses just long enough to think.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sense of caring and resolve comes over them. At least n they know what needs to be done. ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should get to bed.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be up.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL turns to go upstairs as ANNA starts in again with th machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW stands in the hallway about to knock, but he waits a beat. He knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to a young woman, presumably JULIAN'S wife LUISA.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Julian here? 92   LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel would like to speak with him. To help him.  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will tell him. JULIAN steps into the frame from behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRIVER is sitting in the driver's seat. ANDREW walks up gets in the front seat. JULIAN gets into the back and loo over at ABEL who is sitting next to him. They drive off a nobody says a word for a very, very long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car finally pulls into a large empty parking lot. For couple beats JULIAN has a look on his face that he may be getting rubbed out. Then off in the distance we see two cop cars. The car pul up to them and stops. ABEL and the DRIVER get out of the without a word, but ANDREW stays and turns around and now gives him a total debrief.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's turning me in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW looks at him without much remorse.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we are turning you in. You have put everything that man has worked for for the last 20 years at risk. If it was up to me we would be dealing with this in a very different way.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I know things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This causes ANDREW to turn quickly back to him with as sh a look as he has.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? 93   JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what things do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I strongly suggest you think that through before you answer it. Because even if you did, what does it do for you? Nothing. There is nothing there for you to gain. Nothing.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW now changes his tone.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They say they have you firing four shots, is that right?  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN stutters for a moment, then.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I threw it in the river.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Your background check with us says you have never been arrested, is that true?  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is this putting everything at risk?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been arrested?  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. 94   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because no bank will touch us right now. So we can't close on the new property. And he's going to lose everything on his deposit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sits heavily on JULIAN. ANDREW hands him a card.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a lawyer who will meet you when they bring you to the station. You no longer work for us. You've been fired. But Abel wants to pay for the lawyer. So... this guy should be able to help you. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that JULIAN gets out of the car. ABEL is standing th They meet.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you scared?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL thinks this through long and hard.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have always been much more scared of failure than anything else.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't always like this. 95   JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ruined? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today... but by the end of the week... maybe.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good...  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I am not strong.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does not have to be true.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me... I am not... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that JULIAN walks across the parking lot towards the POLICE to turn himself in. ANDREW walks up behind ABEL an stands there looking. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late. I will meet you at four.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna try to get us a little more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three COPS are standing waiting as JULIAN walks towar them. ABEL turns around, facing the camera, and closes hi eyes in sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With ABEL in the foreground we see JULIAN make it halfway the COPS, then he stops.  COP 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL'S face tells us he knows what is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN sets off running. Before the COPS can get close to he is off. ABEL turns and sees what is happening. He does follow chase. His head just drops. 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are now with JULIAN again, running. But as this chase continues we see his face turn from fear, to desperation, a creeping sense of evil. He does not know how it has com this, but as he jumps down from fences and runs across deserted lots we see that his weakness is turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he runs through some of the most bombed-out, destroyed sections of Queens, he just never stops. With each step h fear turns to... anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, collapses, and hides behind a blown-out buildin wall just as a COP CAR drives by. He starts to almost cry but then it again becomes something else. His survival instinct is taking over and we are not sure what will bec of it. Anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL sits across from the oldest Hasidic member of the family, JOSEPH, from the first scene. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for seeing me.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need more time.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know our agreement doesn't allow for that. But... I need more time.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This takes ABEL back a bit.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for asking. Many, many reasons. 97   JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a difficult time to do business.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... it is.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you three more days. Then it's over. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW sits across from LAWRENCE and DEPUTY LANGE. They w while LAWRENCE writes something down on a pad in front of him. He finishes.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: So. I should start by thanking you for your assistance in... in attempting to bring in your driver? ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't think he'd react that way.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Yes... Well, the officers there didn't set it up very well on their end either.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: We are looking for him.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are we... it's very sad. He was very close to Abel.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I understand. Well... Ms. Lange.  DEPUTY LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been brought to our attention that it might be beneficial on your end to resolve this issue in a time sensitive way. 98   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly. DEPUTY LANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we have prepared an offer for you to review.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slide the offer across the table. ANDREW opens it an gives it a once over. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show this to them. He'll never go for it, but it's a start.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: This could get a lot worse for you all.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... I will present it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW gets up and prepares to leave. LAWRENCE stands wit him and walks him out into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: And Andrew, one other thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. They are now alone in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I need this to stop.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need what to stop?

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: This fucking bullshit with the open warfare. I won't put up with it. It's starting to be a real problem.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting to be? No shit.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Not for you... but for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lingers for a beat as the meaning sinks in. 99

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need the driver. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. The kid went out and got his own gun. This was not us. No matter what you think of him, Abel doesn't work this way.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I really could give a fuck, but you need to get your man to talk to these people, give in, stop doing whatever you are doing to bring this shit on you. It needs to stop.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to talk to them. We've been trying to set up a meeting. O'Leary hasn't been able to get it done.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'll talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's an old friend... and get that kid back in here. I'm up in it a little bit here and I need something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAWRENCE turns and walks back into his office. ANDREW wal down the hallway all alone then stops. He reaches into hi briefcase and takes out the offer. He looks it over again Then he looks towards the ground and almost looks like he might cry. There is a distinct sense of responsibility fo the situation that ABEL finds himself in that is starting bring ANDREW to the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is waiting standing next to his car. ANDREW comes driving into the lot next to him and gets out.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to the Hasid, I got us three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW nods. 100   ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that enough? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here it is. It's just a first pass. He hands him the plea deal from the DA. ABEL looks it ove but shows almost no emotion. Then.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felons can't vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This takes ANDREW back.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This plea has me...  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's just a first offer. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never take this.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks off and resets.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's going to get us the meeting.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence, he's tight with O'Leary.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he is.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Julian have anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL gives him a look?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW WALSH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything on us? 101   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the drivers could have us on scales. Why?  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we are cutting deals, we can't have anything new come up at the last minute.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would never do that.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find him... Lawrence needs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL stands outside the door for a very long beat then finally knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN'S wife, LUISA, opens the door. She gestures him in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the apartment and looks around. She gestures fo him to sit. He chooses a seat right across from her. He stares at her for a beat. Then for the first time we hear speak Spanish. (This whole conversation is in Spanish)  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for letting me in.  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL moves his chair closer. It's meant to be, and is a b threatening.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Julian?  LUISA
