dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL questions her with a look.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find him.  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am worried about him. 102   LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know we were going to support him. I do not know why he ran.  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was scared. ABEL shakes his head.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has always wanted to make you proud. You know that right?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Well this time that hasn't worked out.  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... How did you do it? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions towards his suit.  LUISA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Success... that's all he wanted.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It makes me very sad, because he is a very talented young man. But there are some decisions that you cannot come back from. I need to know where he is. And I need him to turn himself in. His actions are hurting me and my business. And I refuse to let other people's weaknesses hurt me. I don't know how it has come to this, but it has. If he does the right thing I will help to take care of his responsibilities. You and your family. When you see him. Tell him this. Please. 103   LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. ABEL gets up and starts looking around the apartment a bi He walks over to a small cabinet.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have any money?  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money? Has he taken money out of your bank account?  LUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to start looking into these things. It is very important that we find him safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that JULIAN comes smashing out of the tiny cabin where he was hiding and knocks over ABEL. JULIAN runs to front door with ABEL chasing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts flying down the stairs at top panic speed. ABEL follows him down half the flight and realizes it is usele  ABEL (CONT'D) (IN ENGLISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop running away! Andrew! He's coming your way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is screamed at the top of his lungs but JULIAN never stops. We just hear his footsteps going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW comes up the first few steps and we see him waitin for JULIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL then looks back up the half flight of stairs and see LUISA standing there in the hall. He walks back up to her an aggressive way. We fear for her. He gets right up in h face but does not touch her.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish again) I understand why you lied, but it is not smart. (MORE) 104  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other people looking for him. I am as good an option as he has. Know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that he heads down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN is running out the back of the building and down a huge exterior staircase that is in a small park. He is ab half way down when ANDREW gets to the top. ANDREW screams  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck You! You better run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL sits across a table from an OLD MAN in his late-70's seems to have early-onset dementia and a WOMAN in her ear 20's, LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ who's overweight, but confident. old man, SAUL LEFKOWITZ, just sits there through the scen  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you both for agreeing to meet with me.  LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we have met before but I didn't realize you were Saul's Granddaughter.  LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to ask but how old are you?  LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm 23.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Grandfather didn't trust any of his children to run the business. 105   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that you tried to buy the company from my Grandfather several times.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His goal was to stay healthy long enough to be able to give the company to me. Which he thankfully did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both give a slight smile.

dialogues.speaker: LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, while I appreciate your visit we are still not for sale.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. And I hope that your Grandfather was able to communicate to you how much I have always respected him. And it was only out of respect for the business he had built, and because I knew of his reservations and feelings about your uncles and your father that I made those offers.  LORAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I am not here to offer to buy your company.  LORAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I'm sure you will soon learn some years are good... others not so. I am in contract with a significant hard deposit at risk to purchase the old Bayfront terminal.  LORAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. 106   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And due to circumstances beyond my control my bank has left me at the altar.  LORAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I am here, hat in hand, looking for a loan. I certainly expect the terms to be in your favor as I could not be at a weaker place. But, if your Grandfather trusted you with his company, I would be willing to trust you as my lien holder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stare at each other. Then the old man shifts in chair.  SAUL LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need $500,000. SAUL and his GRANDDAUGHTER look at each other. They say nothing but clearly know each other well.  LORAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you give us a minute.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL sits in a simple chair outside the conference room looking around at an office that is similar to his. A pho on the receptionist's desk rings. She picks it up.  LEFKOWITZ RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL sits down.  LORAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can offer you the 500k at 20 percent for a year. (MORE) 107

dialogues.speaker: LORAINE LEFKOWITZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And we would need a five-year straight wholesale holding agreement for 250,000 gallons a year at your new facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hits ABEL hard.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you. They shake hands and then he hugs the old man good bye.  LORAINE LEFKOWITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess we will see you tonight?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight? Oh yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOSTESS leads ABEL and ANDREW through the whole main di room and through a side kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally they come through a door and into a small back private dining room where fifteen of their COMPETITORS, a couple of whom we have already met (Including LORRAINE an SAUL LEFKOWITZ, and ARNOLD KLINE), are sitting around the table meeting and waiting for them to arrive. The whole r looks up at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'LEARY is at the head of the table at the far end of the room. He stands up to greet them and then so does the res the room.  BILL O'LEARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel. Please sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally everyone settles and the room falls quiet.

dialogues.speaker: BILL O'LEARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Abel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the room is silent as it waits and waits for him to speak.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop... 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is deadly serious. He just lets this sit and looks around the room at each person. They all seem to be waiti for him to continue. But he doesn't. He just lets this si Finally PETER FORENTE, who is across from ABEL, shifts in seat and leans forward.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Abel... we had a chance to meet for a little bit before you got here and... of course everyone in this room is fully capable of lying to their own mothers on their deathbeds, but... the conclusion we have come to... I should say we are fairly convinced after a very frank conversation... that these guys who are doing this... that they don't actually work for anyone in this room. As you know there are many other smaller providers in the area that might be responsible who are not here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sits in the room for a long beat. Everyone then shif back their attention to ABEL waiting for his response. Finally. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter... thank you... That may be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and thinks about how to continue.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But over the last six months 110,000 gallons of fuel has been stolen from my family and I. Now the reason we asked Bill to get you all here is because the people in this room are the only people within two hundred miles of here who have the ability to purchase and store that kind of quantity. So... no matter what bullshit you have been telling each other one of you... or two... or three... has been allowing this to happen by buying this from these cowards or worse yet hiring these guys just to do it. And profiting from it. So what I am saying is... Stop! Now. Have some pride in what you do and stop. 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves slowly across a dark hallway. We hear th sounds of a manual adding machine grinding away. As we co through the doorway we see ANNA MORALES sitting at her de in a pool of light from the desk lamp. She is deep in it crunching numbers. Finally ABEL walks into the doorway, h looks exhausted.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up with a small but sweet smile.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it coming?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made it to 1975.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a good year. ANNA gives a slight look that the numbers may not totally support that claim.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it was for me...how is it?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure yet... but it's not as bad as they are saying it is... I guess I knew what I was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They give each other a slight smile.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got us a three more days... and one piece... from Saul. But we're still about a million short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concern and exhaustion creep onto Abel's face.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to see your little brother? 110   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Peter?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel is now sitting down on the chair. ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are the girls? I feel like I haven't seen them in days.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNA gets up from her desk and comes over to him.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses just long enough to think.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at us...it is.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sense of caring and resolve comes over them. At least n they know what needs to be done.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get to bed.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be up.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL turns to go upstairs as ANNA starts in again with th machine. 111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is driving towards the office and is listening to th idle chatter on the radio between the dispatcher and the drivers who are out. They are underneath the Brooklyn Que Expressway in stop and go traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a panic stricken VOICE blasts through on the rad

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR DRIVER EDDY V.O.
dialogues.text: Motherfuckers!

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DISPATCHER V.O.
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR DRIVER EDDY V.O.
dialogues.text: It's 17. Two guys are coming at me.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DISPATCHER V.O.
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now hear the driver yell at the TWO GUYS coming at him

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR DRIVER EDDY V.O.
dialogues.text: Fuck you! RADIO DISPATCHER V.O. Where are you!

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR DRIVER EDDY V.O.
dialogues.text: Hall Street and Flushing Ave. I'm out of...

dialogues.speaker: RADIO DISPATCHER V.O.
dialogues.text: Eddy? Eddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks up at the street where they are and realizes t is going down right down the street from them. He's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls across the intersection and heads down a street. comes to the next intersection and right in front of him truck comes flying by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to his right and sees EDDY standing at the side the road. But he wants to end this. So he pulls out and starts following the truck leaving EDDY behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL follows the truck for several blocks through the industrial neighborhood. He is tempted to pull up alongsi of it to see who is driving but doesn't. He continues to follow him. 112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get to a light and the truck makes a right hand turn and, as they are turning, LOUIS SERVIDIO who is sitting i the passenger seat looks behind him and sees that ABEL is following him. It now turns into a high speed chase as th driver steps on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race down a ramp into a railyard. ABEL chases the tr as it crosses the tracks and heads towards an abandoned tunnel. The truck races into the tunnel and ABEL follows. truck is throwing up a dust storm and ABEL has a difficul time seeing where he is going but he keeps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roadway is very bumpy and both the truck and ABEL'S c are thrown around and the truck almost hits the sides of tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light at the end of the tunnel starts to appear throu the dust but we can't see the truck. As ABEL comes into t light he has to SLAM on his brakes because the TRUCK has flipped over in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he gets out of his car he sees LOUIS SERVIDIO jumping from the overturned cab and run off into the train yard. looks at the crushed cab of the truck and sees the DRIVER been killed. There is a gun sitting on the dash of the tr and ABEL looks and thinks. He then picks up the gun and chases after LOUIS SERVIDIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance he sees LOUIS SERVIDIO leave the yard and head up into an elevated subway station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL runs up the stairs of the station and hops onto a leaving train just as the doors shut. ABEL looks around. There are three people in his car. It is covered in graff He starts making his way down to the end of the train whe the guy is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks into the last car and sees LOUIS SERVIDIO and ju bull rushes him to the ground. He starts beating on him v very badly with the pistol. All the rage comes out of him then aims the gun at LOUIS SERVIDIO.  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend is dead... who do you work for. 113   LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I could never tell you that.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop... just stop.  LOUIS SERVIDIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was it anyway. Okay... Okay. ABEL looks right through him and then finally lowers the and releases his hands from around his jacket and he gets and looks back at ABEL.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS SERVIDIO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUIS SERVIDIO then runs out of the car as the door opens ABEL sits up and slows his breathing down. Finally he loo around the trashed car and sees that a woman has been in car with them the whole time and she is just staring at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks into the shop and is a little put back togethe but is worse for the wear. ARNOLD KLINE is sitting in one the chairs waiting. He turns to ABEL.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, can you give me a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks around then walks into the back.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel, that was well said.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just come to collect that check you owe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This takes him back a step.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What check is that? 114   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one for $213,000. ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how much has been taken from me over the last six months. ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had nothing to do with that.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Far Rockaway facility bought a load of fuel last week off one of my stolen trucks.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not possible.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was standing on top of one of my hi-jacked trucks a couple weeks ago thinking about the cowards who did this when I remembered I had bought the load of fuel off a friend's tanker straight from Texas. As I'm sure you know Texas #4 is marked. But that was just one load, so every truck that has left my lot for the last two weeks has been marked with dye that I've put in... And luckily four more of my trucks got jacked since.... My guess is there are at least 4600 gallons of marked fuel in your small tank right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Finally.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said...213,000.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need a day.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL gets ready to leave. 115   ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just been buying this stuff off these guys, it was only a couple loads, I don't know who they are. I would never do that.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goal was to have you out of business by the end of next year. And if you're this fucking desperate it doesn't seem like it will even take that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel, I wasn't the only person buying this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.  ARNOLD KLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may ruin me. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you find out who else it was you can get them to pay you back the difference. Kinda makes you miss having your father around? But I need the whole lot tomorrow or the feds will be at your doorstep by noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is sitting on a bleacher totally alone watching a pr school football practice. We stay with him as he sits qui just watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually his 21-YEAR-OLD YOUNGER BROTHER, ELIAS, comes walking off the field over to him. PLAYERS start leaving field.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good out there.  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were coming. 116   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't either... I didn't mean to take you away.  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down next to him. They both look out for a long, beat. ELIAS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. You've grown.  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw me a month ago.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... but you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks across as a small group of GIRLS FIELD HOCKEY PLAYERS walk across the field in front of them. They watc them pass and walk away. ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls at this place... they are so beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over with a wry smile.  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you get anything done around here.  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slight smile at each other.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a bit of a rough patch.  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens. 117   ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL stands and looks around for a good bit. Then thinks about sitting down again.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will be your burden...  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not having had one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he sits.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your signature on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIAS looks over.  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to take out a short term mortgage on our apartment building.  ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing isn't worth more than 150 grand though?  ABEL
ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you need to be taking out sucker mortgages for 200 grand?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm up against it a bit. It will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a long beat. And then he sign it.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... It's good to see your face. 118   ELIAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug and then ELIAS walks off. ABEL sits back down an just watches him walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks into the darkened tennis court and looks aroun We aren't sure what he is there for. On the other side of court a light is on in a attached lounge. PETER comes int the light.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here he is. The caped crusader.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over. Are you alright? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they catch any of them? Sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one guy didn't make it out of the crash, and the other guy disappeared.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was very well said last night.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And thanks for seeing me.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. So what is it?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a loan. 119

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER'S face scrunches up like he tasted a lemon and he t away for a beat. Then comes back. PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to do that.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit... but I'm here.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we talking about here.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hundred thousand.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Abel, that's a problem.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... but if I don't get it...  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my collateral?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terminal. PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah me and how many other people will be coming after it. No way.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get your money.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel, you know I respect everything you've done. Because of it we haven't come down on you the way I should have for coming into my service area and poaching my customers. You're good at what you do, probably better than us, and I accept that. But this would be different. I don't want you to be in this position. We are not nice people to borrow three quarters of million dollars from.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.  PETER FORENTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's sleep on this. Both of us. 120

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes in as ANNA is sitting at the table smoking. He walks over and sits down at the table with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a great sly smile.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a day. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car chases?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a loving look.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your brother?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seemed good... But the girls up at that place are...  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you the girls didn't look like that where I went to school...  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a brief light moment the cloud comes back over him.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we here? 121   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a lot of things all at once. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it go?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can probably pull it off. Three different parties... it'll be a mess... and the terms... Peter suddenly showed me his true colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets out a brutal sigh.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent my whole life trying not to become a gangster...  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And now... on the biggest deal in my career they will all control me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits there for a long beat and then she comes and hand him a piece of paper with a series of numbers on it. He l up at her.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bank account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL just waits for more but gets nothing.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ours.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is in it? 122   ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will help. You could replace Peter's money and get him out of the deal. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did it come from?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did it come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops and thinks, then:  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since 1971 I have been skimming money out of the company. Some years a little... others a lot. In the beginning it was just in case times got tough but then it was because you were taking all these chances... I didn't know what else to do... I couldn't risk having us be left with nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This knocks him back.  ANNA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you expect me to do with this?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use it.... Abel...  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it clean?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks that through. 123   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means if you walked into the office of the people who have been trying to put us in jail right now and slapped a check from that account down on their desk would it push me further into hell or help to get me out?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as clean as every other dollar we've ever made.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fucking bullshit answer.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can clear it on the books.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it sounds like you should take this money and keep it right where it is... because I'm going to pretend that we never had this conversation. And you can use that when they drag me off to jail! With that he tries to get passed her and head upstairs. S follows and is standing looking up at him.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your plan here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to her and squares off.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it done. And it won't be as a cheat.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Yelling, but controlled enough to not wake the kids.) Oh you are too much. You've been walking around your whole life like this all happened because of your hard work, good luck, and charm. Mr. Fucking American Dream. Well this is America... but it's not a dream, and that wasn't good luck helping you out all those years... IT WAS ME! Doing the things you didn't want to know about... 124   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole from me! This stops her in her tracks. And eventually a little smi comes across her face. She comes way down and almost deli this line in a whisper.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... You have always been very good about not letting your ego get in the way of business. Don't start now just because it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that ABEL turns up the stairs and heads to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL is getting ready for the day shaving. He looks exhausted. ANNA comes into the room. She stands at the entryway just looking at him for a very long beat.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll use the money... your money. It's the smart play. ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our money.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we see anything, we hear the sound of a pen writin paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL and ANDREW are sitting around the folding table oppo the HASIDS. ABEL signs the document and then picks it up heads outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes out and we see ANNA standing outside the trail in the cold because these guys don't do business with wom He hands her the document. Under her breath:  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These fucking guys...what's this additional $11,000? 125   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess there is still some fuel in two of the tanks... they gave us a fair price on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that they both smile, she signs it and then gives hi kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL comes back in and hands the docs to JOSEPH, the olde Hasid, who signs them.  JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazel Tov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL walks across the lot with joy although it seems mask by a sadness. He looks around as ANDREW and ANNA come up to him.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you too. Did you know...about the money?  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW looks him right in the eye.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have told me.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm sorry.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel...congratulations. Now cheer up. And can someone give me a tour of this place we just paid two million bucks for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL, ANDREW, and ANNA walk towards the tanks looking aro They come around the corner to THE VIEW. 126

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look out.  ANNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a hell-hole this city is.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why but I guess I never realized we even had this view from back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That line sits for a long beat.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they hear someone behind them. They turn. It's JULIA He is standing holding a gun. They stare for a long beat.  ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you threw that into the river? JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see that.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nowhere to go.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere easy.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I have nothing. And somehow you've ended up with everything you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks at the gun in his hand.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't meant to be.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean? 127   ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you wanted. But you need to forget that. You are looking backward. Only look forward, that is what you can control.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. You gave me a very good chance. Right? ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably a better chance than I deserved.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please take care of my family.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian. JULIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL looks at him trying to read where this poor kid is a  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that JULIAN takes the gun and puts it in his mouth a pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun goes off and the red blood sprays on the white si of the fuel tank that is behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL and the rest are left totally in shock. They are bes themselves. But out of the corner of his eye ABEL notices that the bullet has also pierced through the tank and ami the red spray a flow of black heating oil is pouring out through the bullet hole onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL steps around JULIAN'S body and goes over to the hole picks up an old rag from the ground and stuffs it into th hole plugging the flow of oil.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what should we do? 128

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL turns and looks back at him. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call the police.  ANDREW WALSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! With that he walks off behind the tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are now POLICE VEHICLES everywhere. ABEL is standin off alone. The DA gets out of a car all alone and walks o to ABEL.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry. Did you know him well?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: He must have been under a hell of a lot of pressure.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. For a while I thought he was... it's just...

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look out across the city.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really do have to be lucky.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Yes... so you are chasing down hijackers now?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was right there... I couldn't help myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAWRENCE nods approval. 129   ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you found the driver?

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: No.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Probably not.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for coming. I wanted to make sure this was handled correctly.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Of course.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure how I got here.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I should tell you that I won't be able to take that deal you offered. There is no way I would ever accept a felony charge for anything we've done.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I know.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a felon.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: That's probably true.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I also can't have you digging around my life and keeping this hanging around my neck for the next ten years. I love fighting a good battle but this... it's very bad for my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets Lawrence's attention. 130   ABEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we need to come to some sort of conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: We can probably do that.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. They both look out for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I hear you closed on this terminal today?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks that way.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I didn't realize that you had that in the works.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: That will put you in quite a powerful position.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within my business it has that potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAWRENCE shifts his tone ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: If you get this place up and running again it will have significant influence... politically speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABEL picks up on the word POLITICALLY and stares down LAWRENCE.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We all have our ambitions.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAWRENCE gives a slight smile and then pauses. 131

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: And sometimes we need help to get there... You've come a very long way.  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: In a very short time. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't feel that way... But please know that I have always chosen the path that was the most right.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: The most right?  ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: That one makes my head hurt a little. ABEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The result is never in question for me. Just what path do I take to get there. And I have never questioned my path. There is always one that is most right. And that is what this is.

dialogues.speaker: A.D.A. LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other and then out over the city.    THE END
